summary: Meta Platforms reported Q1 earnings per share (EPS) of $6.43, more than a dollar higher than what Wall Street analysts were expecting . Microsoft beat expectations on both the top and bottom-line in part due to the strength of their Azure cloud segment . Amazon and Apple posted impressive results for the quarter, but their forward looking guidance was less than rosy .  Microsoft increased their capex forecast for 2025, now anticipated to put roughly $80B into the buildout of their AI data centers . Microsoft stock rose 9% in the trading period after their report, while Meta was up 5% . The story was a little different for Amazon and Apple which reported Thursday .  Apple cited tariffs as a major headwind in the current quarter, expected to impact profits to the tune of $900M . As a result the company forecasted operating income for Q2 would be in the range of $13B - $17.5B . Peak earnings season continues with 92 S&P 500 names slated to release results .  Academic research shows that when a company confirms a quarterly earnings date that is later than when they have historically reported, it's typically a sign that the company will share negative news . Eight companies within the S&P 500 confirmed outlier earnings dates for this week, all of which are later than usual and therefore have negative results .  Ford Motor Company (F), The Clorox Company (CLX), IQVIA Holdings (IQV), Archer Daniels Midland (ADM), Johnson Controls (JCI), Federal Realty Investment Trust (FRT) and ConocoPhillips (COP) are all on our list for this week . The Consumer Staples sector tends to do well in uncertain times, as these companies sell products that are necessary for daily living .  Initial jobless claims came in at seasonally adjusted 241,000 for the week ended April 26, up 18,000 from the prior period . Continuing claims for those continuing to receive benefits rose to 1.92M, the highest level since November 13, 2021 . On a more upbeat note, April US nonfarm payrolls showed a monthly increase .  The second week of peak earnings season begins this week and continues until May 16 . May 8 is predicted to be the most active day with 1,174 companies anticipated to report . The unemployment rate stayed the same at 4.2% .  Meta Platforms First Quarter 2025 Results Conference Call, April 30, 2025,https://s21.q4cdn.com . Amazon Announces First Quarter Results, May 1, 2025 . Apple Q1 2025 Earnings Call Transcript: May 1- 2025 .  Consumer Confidence Plunged Again in April, The Conference Board, April 29, 2025,https://www.conference-board.org15 March 2025 Advance Monthly Sales for Retail and Food Services, US Census Bureau, April 16, 2025 . The Trump administration and congressional officials are scrutinizing a deal between Apple and Alibaba . The deal would bring Alibaba-powered AI features to iPhones sold in China . The NYT says White House officials and members of Congress have asked Apple executives directly about the deal .  U.S. lawmakers have concerns about Apple's deal with Alibaba . The iPhone maker also faces the threat of increased tariffs from China . This is not the only challenge facing Apple in China .

US President Donald Trump wrapped up his tour of the Middle East today, concluding numerous high-profile deals and diplomatic engagements with countries such as Saudi Arabia, Qatar, and the United Arab Emirates . Trump inked a massive AI data centre project where the two countries will be partnering on an artificial intelligence campus .  The US and UAE have agreed to deepen cooperation in artificial intelligence . The countries did not specify which AI chips from Nvidia or other companies could be included in the data centres .  Wedbush reiterated the stock as “Outperform” with a $270 price target . The firm said that Apple is doubling down on its production strategy for the iPhone 17, and that its manufacturing will be centered in India and China . Wedbush praised CEO Tim Cook for managing an �precedented supply chain situation .  AAPLranks 5thon our list of trending AI stocks on Wall Street right now . While we acknowledge the potential of AAPL as an investment, our conviction lies in the belief that some AI stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns .

Apple investors are likely breathing a sigh of relief, given the amount of manufacturing Apple does in China . The state of Apple stock could negate any benefits from a U.S.-China trade agreement . Apple recently lost its market caplead to Nvidia, which is now just behindMicrosoft's $3.35 trillion capitalization .  Ives is likely right to take a more bullish view on Apple amid the U.S.-China trade talks . The iPhone still made up 53% of the company's revenue in the first six months of fiscal 2025 . Apple claims approximately $157 billion in liquidity, likely giving it more optionality than any public company except for Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway .  Ives' bullish call may have overlooked the serious shortcomings that led to Apple losing its market cap lead . The immediate agreement with China is a 90-day pause on tariffs, not an agreement that takes the issue off the table . Investors should likely prepare for this issue to return to the forefront in the coming months .  Revenue in the first two quarters of fiscal 2025 was $220 billion, an increase of 4% . That led to a net income of $61 billion for the same period, 6% higher than year-ago levels . While these are still increases, it shows Apple is no longer the growth name it was in the past .  Investors should probably take Ives' optimism with a grain of salt and refrain from adding shares of Apple stock . A single-digit growth rate on its profits and the loss of its market cap lead are significant signs of the company's maturing . It is also less of an innovator and maintains a relatively high P/E ratio .  The S&P 500's average return is975% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to172%for the S-P 500 . Stocks entered the green for the year as investors cheered the US-China trade thaw . The "Magnificent Seven" tech stocks continued theirrenewed ascent . Earnings from economic bellwethers Cisco (CSCO) and Walmart (WMT) didn't completely suck .  Ex-Medtronic CEO Bill George says CEOs should get away from corporate guidance . He says earnings estimates and corporate guidance are useless in a backdrop where one social media post could blow up company's financial planning .  Walmart reiterated its full-year earnings per share forecast on Thursday after ratcheting down expectations at an investor event several weeks ago . Executives went on to say they would start raising prices (by raising prices)  If tariffs go back to pre-thaw levels, it may render guidance obsolete . Yet, the guidance is out there . Mattel CEO Ynon Kreiz decided to pull guidance altogether because of trade uncertainty . United Airlines (UAL) still has its double guidance range out there(which numerous execs have privately made fun of). Yet despite all the confusion, we have the Street looking for earnings growth north of 10% this year .  Earnings estimates and guidance have historically proven to be important drivers of stock prices . To the extent they no longer are, I view it as one more problem for investors to contend with in a challenging 2025 .

Warren Buffett has steered the Berkshire Hathaway to market-crushing returns since 1965 . An investment of $1,000 in Berkshire stock in 1965 would have been worth $44.7 million at the end of 2024 . The same investment in theS&P 500 index would have grown to just $342,906 over the same period .  Buffett's brand of long-term investing, which focuses on companies with steady growth, reliable profitability, and strong management teams, is likely to endure . With that said, three existing holdings, which make up 32.9% of Berkshire's $286 billion portfolio, are using AI to supercharge their legacy businesses .  Amazon created its own family of large language models (LLMs) called Nova, which the company claims can save developers up to 75% on costs compared to using other third-party models on the AWS Bedrock platform . Then there is the Amazon Q AI assistant, which is embedded into AWS, which can help businesses analyze their internal data .  Coca-Cola has used AI to create content for interactive marketing campaigns, and even to create a new promotional beverage . In 2024, in 2024, "everything will be generative AI" eventually, says Pratik Thakar .  Coca-Cola signed a deal to spend $1.1 billion over five years withMicrosoftAzure to integrate AI into its manufacturing processes, its supply chains, and deeper into its marketing strategies . Buffett and his team spent approximately $38 billion accumulatingApple shares between 2016 and 2023 . That position was worth over $170 billion, accounting for around half of Berkshire's entire portfolio .  Apple has been preparing for the AI revolution for years . The company designs its own chips, and the latest versions for the iPhone, iPad, and Mac computers were crafted with AI workloads in mind . Apple Intelligence provides users with powerful new writing tools, allowing them to summarize lengthy emails and text messages with a single click .  There are more than 2.35 billion active Apple devices worldwide, so the company could become the biggest distributor of AI to consumers . Berkshire could still earn significant returns from its remaining Apple stake as the company's AI strategy unfolds . Amazon's two growth segments can help propel it to a $10 trillion market cap . Compared to other big tech competitors, it has more room to expand profit margins in the next decade . Amazon's dual growth engines and profit margin expansion potential have the company poised to be the first stock to eclipse a $100 trillion valuation .  Amazon's combined North America and international sales were more than $500 billion over the last year . E-commerce is still less than 20% of retail sales in the United States and has steadily grown for decades . Cloud computing is getting supercharged by artificial intelligence (AI), which is taking the industry to become much bigger .  Amazon's cloud computing division, Amazon Web Services (AWS) is going to capture the majority of the company's planned $100 billion in capital expenditures in 2025 . I think AWS has a clear path to expand to $200 billion and eventually $300 billion in revenue over the next decade and beyond .  Amazon's combined revenue will eventually reach $2 trillion in the next 10 to 20 years . Amazon's competitors in big tech do not have the large addressable market afforded to Amazon by dominating both e-commerce and cloud computing . Amazon has a much clearer revenue growth path to help it achieve the hundreds of billions of dollars in annual earnings needed to warrant this valuation .  Amazon stock is my bet to be the first stock with a $10 trillion market value . Now is the best time to buy before it’s too late . Right now, we’re issuing “Double Down” alerts for three incredible companies, available when you joinStock Advisor .  Amazon will be Wall Street's first $10 Trillion company, and it's not Apple . Apple could be looking to reinvent its Safari search engine through AI . The iPhone maker does significant manufacturing abroad, especially in China, the current administration's favorite tariff target . Even so, Apple's large installed base grants it plenty of lucrative monetization opportunities .  According to court testimony from Apple executive Eddy Cue, Apple may be planning to integrate artificial intelligence into its Safari search capabilities . Cue's testimony was part of an antitrust lawsuit against Alphabet, whose dominance in search and longstanding partnership with Apple have generated billions for the Google parent company . Apple boasts more than 2.35 billion devices in circulation .  Apple's services segment continues to make headway . Apple has more than a billion paid subscriptions . The company's services unit generated $26.6 billion in sales, 11.6% higher than last quarter .  Apple's total sales grew by 5% year over year to $95.4 billion . Services' gross margin for the quarter was 75.7% compared to 35.9% for devices . As this segment grows and makes up a larger part of the company's revenue, it will boost its bottom line . Computex kicks off Monday in Taipei, Taiwan, for years a showcase for cutting-edge AI chips and companies lining up to buy them . This year's event may well be on another far bigger personality: US President Donald Trump . Executives this time are likely grappling with the uncertainty of the Trump administration’s .  This year’s exhibition will of course feature the hardware required to bring artificial intelligence to life . But while they tout new products onstage, these companies are also confronting profound questions about the US administration's tariff regime . Trump wants manufacturing back home.  Asia’s biggest electronics companies may also find new opportunity in the Middle East . US delegation led by the president led by Elon Musk visited Saudi Arabia's Riyadh with lofty promises of new trade deals .  Intel’s Lip-Bu Tan, the newly appointed chief executive officer of Intel Corp., won’t be at Computex in a formal capacity . The promises from the likes of Samsung Electronics Co. about how transformative AI would be in day-to-day life have not come to pass .  Tan is currently weighing options to reform the storied US chipmaker . He’ll work to persuade customers of TSMC that Intel’s factories are a viable alternative . Tan, who served as CEO of chip-design software, is rebooting everything with a focus on better execution .  Chairman Liu will host a keynote presentation on Tuesday at Computex . Foxconn is working to diversify its revenue away from assembling smartphones and other consumer electronics . The company is also keen on advancing robotics .  Nvidia has been forthcoming with plans to upgrade its AI chips on a roughly annual basis . The company has also talked about the potential of AI in the robotics industry . Microsoft’s developer event, Build, is taking place the same week over in Seattle .  The scrapping of Biden-era AI chip rules will help the United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia acquire more of Nvidia’s technology . Huang joined a US delegation to the Middle East led by the president, lauding the opening up of trade .

Wedbushanalyst,Dan Ivesanticipates thatApple Inc. could increase its iPhone assembly production in India to 60%-65% by fall, depending on tariff negotiations . He added that U.S. iPhone production is “not feasible”  Apple has reassured the Indian government of its commitment to continue using India as a major manufacturing base . Government sources say there is "no change" in Apple's investment plans in India . Apple’s stock recently saw a boost following a breakthrough in trade negotiations between the United States and China . Apple and American Express are two of Berkshire Hathaway's largest investments . You can buy one share of both stocks for just over $500 at the time of writing . The companies have powerful brands that could serve as a solid anchor for a well diversified portfolio .  Buffett invests in companies that have strong competitive advantages . The iPhone generates over half of the company's revenue . The installed base of active devices has grown to 2.3 billion and is still growing .  Over the last year, Apple generated $97 billion in net income on $400 billion of revenue . Analysts expect the company's earnings per share to grow at an annualized rate of 11% over the long term . Buffett's history with American Express goes back 60 years .  American Express has a very strong brand that has proven resilient in the face of economic uncertainty . Total card spending grew 6% year-over-year last quarter, driven by healthy spending on goods and services . 60% of new customer accounts acquired globally were driven by millennials and Gen Z consumers .  Buffett discovered the timeless characteristics of the American Express brand decades ago . Analysts expect earnings to grow at an annualized rate of nearly 14% over the next several years . The average American Express card member has a high income and excellent credit profile .
